conclusion: To find the magnitude of the electric field at point A due to the point charges 2q and -q, consider the distances from each charge to point A and use Coulomb's law.
The distance from the charge 2q to point A is the space diagonal of the cube, d1 = L√3.
The distance from the charge -q to point A is also the space diagonal of the cube, d2 = L√3.
The electric field E due to a point charge Q at a distance r is given by E = kQ/r^2.
The electric field E1 at point A due to 2q is E1 = 2kq/3L^2.
The electric field E2 at point A due to -q is E2 = -kq/3L^2.
The total magnitude of the electric field at point A is EA = E1 + E2 = kq/3L^2.
The magnitude of the electric field strength at the midpoint O of the line connecting the point charges 2q and -q is E.
The distance from 2q to O is L√3/2.
The distance from -q to O is L√3/2.
The fields at O are E_O1 = 8kq/3L^2 and E_O2 = -4kq/3L^2.
The resultant electric field at O is E_O = 4kq/3L^2 = E.
